oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Return J. Meigs correspondence, circa 1805
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Meigs, Return Jonathan, 1740-1823
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Indian Affairs agent Return J. Meigs advocating for Gideon Blackburn as superintendent of the Cherokee Mission in Hamiton County, Tennesse, citing Blackburn's previous experience creating a Cherokee mission on the Hiwassee River in Tennessee in 1804.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cherokee Indians -- History; Cherokee Indians -- Missions
Blackburn, Gideon, 1772-1838; Meigs, Return Jonathan, 1740-1823
Brainerd Mission; United States. Bureau of Indian Affairs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Penelope Johnson Allen Brainerd Mission correspondence and photographs
